document_data.name: Heartstone Gem
document_data.mainbody: The '''Heartstone Gem''' was a powerful artifact kept in the village of [[Kuldahar]].
document_data.Description: The Heartstone Gem was a green stone, appearing like a [[gem|gemstone]].
document_data.Powers: The gem had long range [[divination]], healing and the power to see what is hidden from standard divination. It required tremendous magical or priestly power to use it. The artifact was the reason that Kuldahar was in the state of eternal summer, along with the [[Great Oak]].
document_data.History:
The origin of the Heartstone Gem was unknown. It resided for a long time in the druid's shrine in Kuldahar; the druids used its powers of divination to see the surrounding lands and look into the affairs of people throughout the [[Realms]].

A young druid had grown tired of the humble teachings of his mentor the archdruid, and hungered for power of his own. He stole the Heartstone Gem and it eventually ended up in a [[Temple of the Forgotten God|temple]] dedicated to the mysterious [[Forgotten God]]. The priests of the same deity placed it on an altar deep within their temple, but the part it played in their religion like anything else of their faith, was unknown.

The Heartstone Gem was later stolen by snake-worshiping cultists, apparently [[tainted one]]s who were agents of the [[marilith]] [[Yxunomei]]. When Yxunomei was defeated by the an adventuring group, the gem was taken to the undead archmage elven [[Larrel]], who used its powers to the benefit of the adventurers.

The gem was returned to Kuldahar in the early 14{{th}} century, where its circle of warmth grew larger.
